name: Cain
description: First son born to humanity, first murderer. Tiller of the ground whose offering was rejected while Abel's was accepted. Killed his brother in the field, cried 'Am I my brother's keeper?', and was marked by God to wander but not be killed. Built the first city.
attributeDescription: A simple hoe or sickle, representative of his work as a farmer, often stained with earth.
visualStyle: Realist painting style with earthy tones and strong chiaroscuro.
clothing: Roughspun tunic of undyed wool or animal hide, secured with a simple leather belt. Barefoot or with roughly made sandals.

offering-ground.name: Offering from the Ground
offering-ground.description: Presenting his offering of produce to God
offering-ground.prompt: kneeling before altar of rough stones - offering selection of fruits and vegetables. Face showing resentment and barely concealed anger at the knowledge that Abel's offering will be preferred. The Midrash says Cain offered leftovers while Abel offered firstborn. Smoke dispersing, not rising.

smoke-descending.name: Smoke Descending
smoke-descending.description: The moment of rejection - Cain's smoke disperses
smoke-descending.prompt: standing before altar watching smoke disperse and descend - while in background or beside him, Abel's smoke rises straight to heaven. Face falling, fury beginning to build. 'The LORD looked with favor on Abel and his offering, but on Cain and his offering He did not look.'

brooding-anger.name: Brooding Anger
brooding-anger.description: Consumed by anger after his offering is rejected
brooding-anger.prompt: standing in field with head bowed - fists clenched, dark clouds gathering overhead echoing his mood. Eyes cast down, radiating barely-contained fury. 'Why are you angry? Why has your countenance fallen?' But Cain does not master sin crouching at the door.

sin-at-door.name: Sin Crouching at the Door
sin-at-door.description: The moment of God's warning to Cain
sin-at-door.expression: hearing the warning, not heeding it
sin-at-door.prompt: perhaps seeing a demon-like shadow crouching at a doorway or at his feet - 'sin crouches at the door; its desire is for you, but you must rule over it.' Face showing he hears but will not listen. The last warning before murder.

fratricide.name: The First Murder
fratricide.description: Standing over his fallen brother Abel
fratricide.prompt: standing over Abel's lifeless body in field - holding rock or crude weapon, face showing shock and dawning horror at consequences. 'Cain rose up against Abel his brother and killed him.' The first blood spilled by human hand. Sky bruised purple reflecting violence.

brothers-keeper.name: Am I My Brother's Keeper
brothers-keeper.prompt: standing with arms spread in denial or accusation - 'Where is Abel your brother?' 'I do not know; am I my brother's keeper?' Face showing defiance rather than repentance. Trying to hide from the One who sees all.
brothers-keeper.energy: defiant, evasive, the first lie about murder

cursed-earth.name: Cursed from the Earth
cursed-earth.description: Receiving God's curse after killing Abel
cursed-earth.expression: despair, anguish, understanding the weight of sin
cursed-earth.prompt: kneeling or cowering before divine presence - hands raised in supplication, face etched with despair. 'The voice of your brother's blood cries out to Me from the ground.' The ground beneath cracked and barren. Cursed to be unable to farm.

my-punishment-too-great.name: My Punishment Is Too Great
my-punishment-too-great.description: Cain's cry of despair at his sentence
my-punishment-too-great.prompt: face raised to heaven in anguish - 'My punishment is too great to bear! Anyone who finds me will kill me!' Fear of being killed mixed with the weight of exile. The murderer fears being murdered.

marked-by-god.name: The Mark of Cain
marked-by-god.description: Receiving the divine mark of protection
marked-by-god.prompt: standing with visible mark on forehead or body - divine light touching him, marking him. 'The LORD set a mark upon Cain, lest anyone finding him should kill him.' Protected from vengeance, yet branded forever. The strange mercy to a murderer.
marked-by-god.energy: divine mercy to the guilty, marked forever

wandering-nomad.name: Wandering Nomad
wandering-nomad.description: Wandering the earth as a fugitive
wandering-nomad.prompt: walking alone across desolate landscape - carrying meager bundle, face weathered and haunted. 'A fugitive and a wanderer you shall be on the earth.' Endless horizon behind him, no home. The land of Nod — the land of wandering.

building-city.name: Builder of Enoch
building-city.description: Overseeing the construction of the city Enoch
building-city.expression: stoic, hardened, mixture of pride and regret
building-city.prompt: standing amidst early construction of walled city - overseeing laborers, face stoic and hardened. Named it after his son Enoch. Pride mixed with regret — the wanderer trying to build permanence, the murderer trying to create civilization.

rivalry-offerings.name: Rivalry: The Offerings
rivalry-offerings.description: Cain at his altar, smoke descending, rejected
rivalry-offerings.prompt: Cain stands stiffly before his altar, presenting grain and fruit. His face shows resentment and barely concealed anger. Smoke disperses and descends, rejected. The cultivated field stretches behind him. In contrast to Abel's ascending smoke visible nearby.
rivalry-offerings.energy: Rejected, jealous, the offering not accepted

rivalry-murder.name: Rivalry: The Murder
rivalry-murder.prompt: Cain raises a rock or weapon above his head, face contorted with jealous rage. The culmination of his festering resentment. About to commit the first murder. Abel perhaps visible, defending or already fallen. The field, the moment, the irreversible act.

rivalry-blood-ground.name: Rivalry: Blood from the Ground
rivalry-blood-ground.description: Cain confronted by Abel's blood crying from earth
rivalry-blood-ground.prompt: Cain stands alone, looking at his bloodied hands with dawning horror. The earth beneath his feet seems to pulse or glow red. He cannot escape what he has done. 'The voice of your brother's blood cries out to Me from the ground.' The witness that won't be silenced.

rivalry-the-mark.name: Rivalry: The Mark
rivalry-the-mark.description: Cain marked by God, departing into exile
rivalry-the-mark.prompt: Cain walking away into the wilderness, the mark visible on him. The land of Nod ahead — the land of wandering. Protected from death but exiled from presence. Abel's memory behind him, the ground that won't yield for him beneath his feet.
